blocks.name: searchContent
blocks.description: You can find all parts of the content in the API

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Guardian

args.name: query
args.info: Request content containing this free text. Supports AND, OR and NOT operators, and exact phrase queries using double quotes.

args.name: section
args.info: Return only content in those sections. Example: football

args.name: reference
args.info: Return only content with those references. Example: isbn/9780718178949

args.name: reference-type
args.info: Return only content with references of those types. Example: isbn

args.name: tag
args.info: Return only content with those tags. Example: technology/apple

args.name: rights
args.info: Return only content with those rights. Example: syndicatable | subscription-databases

args.name: ids
args.info: Return only content with those IDs. Example: technology/2014/feb/17/flappy-bird-clones-apple-google

args.name: production-office
args.info: Return only content from those production offices. Example: aus

args.name: lang
args.info: Return only content in those languages. ISO language codes. Example: fr

args.name: star-rating
args.info: Return only content with a given star rating. From 1 to 5

args.name: from-date
args.info: Return only content published on or after that date. Example: 2014-02-16

args.name: to-date
args.info: Return only content published on or before that date. Example: 2014-02-17

args.name: use-date
args.info: Changes which type of date is used to filter the results using from-date and to-date. Accepted values: published, newspaper-edition, last-modified

args.name: page
args.info: Return only the result set from a particular page. Example: 5

args.name: page-size
args.info: Modify the number of items displayed per page. Accepted values: 1 to 50

args.name: order-by
args.info: Returns results in the specified order. Accepted values: newest, oldest, relevance

args.name: order-date
args.info: Returns results in the specified order. Accepted values: published, newspaper-edition, last-modified

args.name: show-tags
args.info: Add associated metadata tags. Example: publication

args.name: show-fields
args.info: Add fields associated with the content

args.name: show-section
args.info: Add associated metadata section

args.name: show-blocks
args.info: Add associated blocks

args.name: show-elements
args.info: Add associated media elements such as images and audio. Accepted values: audio,image,video,all

args.name: show-references
args.info: Add associated reference data such as ISBNs

args.name: show-rights
args.info: Add associated rights. Accepted values: syndicatable, subscription-databases, all

blocks.name: getTags
blocks.description: Returns all tags in the Guardian API. All Guardian content is manually categorised using these tags, of which there are more than 50,000.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Guardian

args.name: query
args.info: Request tags containing this free text. Example: sausages

args.name: type
args.info: Return only tags of those types

args.name: section
args.info: Return only tags in those sections. Example: football

args.name: reference
args.info: Return only tags with those references. Example: isbn/9780718178949

args.name: reference-type
args.info: Return only tags with references of those types. Example: isbn

args.name: page
args.info: Returns results only for that page index. Example: 5

args.name: page-size
args.info: Modify the number of items displayed per page. Example: 10

args.name: show-references
args.info: Add associated reference data such as ISBNs

blocks.name: getSections
blocks.description: Returns all sections in the Guardian API.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Guardian

args.name: query
args.info: Request tags containing this free text. Example: sausages

blocks.name: getEditions
blocks.description: Returns all returns all editions in the Guardian API. Editions are the different front main pages of the Guardian site we have. At current we have editions for the United Kingdom, the United States and Australia.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Guardian

args.name: query
args.info: Return section based on the query term specified. Example: business

blocks.name: getSingleItem
blocks.description: Returns all the data we have for a given single item id. Here the term 'item' refers to either a piece of content, a tag, or a section. The item endpoint matches the paths on theguardian.com.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Guardian

args.name: id
args.info: The ID for an item, such as a piece of content, is the path to that item on the site.

args.name: section
args.info: Return only content in those sections. Example: football

args.name: reference
args.info: Return only content with those references. Example: isbn/9780718178949

args.name: reference-type
args.info: Return only content with references of those types. Example: isbn

args.name: tag
args.info: Return only content with those tags. Example: technology/apple

args.name: rights
args.info: Return only content with those rights. Example: syndicatable | subscription-databases

args.name: ids
args.info: Return only content with those IDs. Example: technology/2014/feb/17/flappy-bird-clones-apple-google

args.name: production-office
args.info: Return only content from those production offices. Example: aus

args.name: lang
args.info: Return only content in those languages. ISO language codes. Example: fr

args.name: star-rating
args.info: Return only content with a given star rating. From 1 to 5

args.name: from-date
args.info: Return only content published on or after that date. Example: 2014-02-16

args.name: to-date
args.info: Return only content published on or before that date. Example: 2014-02-17

args.name: use-date
args.info: Changes which type of date is used to filter the results using from-date and to-date. Accepted values: published, newspaper-edition, last-modified

args.name: page
args.info: Return only the result set from a particular page. Example: 5

args.name: page-size
args.info: Modify the number of items displayed per page. Accepted values: 1 to 50

args.name: order-by
args.info: Returns results in the specified order. Accepted values: newest, oldest, relevance

args.name: order-date
args.info: Returns results in the specified order. Accepted values: published, newspaper-edition, last-modified

args.name: show-tags
args.info: Add associated metadata tags. Example: publication

args.name: show-fields
args.info: Add fields associated with the content

args.name: show-section
args.info: Add associated metadata section

args.name: show-blocks
args.info: Add associated blocks

args.name: show-elements
args.info: Add associated media elements such as images and audio. Accepted values: audio,image,video,all

args.name: show-references
args.info: Add associated reference data such as ISBNs

args.name: show-rights
args.info: Add associated rights. Accepted values: syndicatable, subscription-databases, all

args.name: show-story-package
args.info: When true display a list of content that is in the has been identified as being about the same story as the requested content item. When a content item is in a package the hasStoryPackage field has a value of true

args.name: show-editors-picks
args.info: When true display a list of content that is chosen by editors on tags, sections and the home page. This content list represents the main list of content found on the equivalent path on the site

args.name: show-most-viewed
args.info: When true display most viewed content. For overall most viewed set id to '/', for section most viewed set id to the section id

args.name: show-related
args.info: Content items can show a set of 'related' content. When true returns content items related to the main content item
